content.description: sit start below elephants,on two jugs, stand up to a positive slopey edge, then share the arete hold with elephants, but stay wide to another sharp deadpoint slot, top out.
content.location: Same as elephants have dreams too
around the corner from gingers dont dance

content.description:
Start "underground" on two perfect horns, make static moves to good edges and a sloper making sure not to crack your dome off the rock below. Move through good edges and pockets to a dicey top out in the opposite corner of where you started.  

slightly contrivedvariation cuts out the underground start
content.protection: pads, and a spotter if you`re uncomfortable with mantle top outs.
content.location: from the main entrance walk maybe 100ft until you see an evil looking fallen tree partially sticking out into the trail...turn right and follow the tree...also a fun little slopey v1 down the hill from it.

content.description:
Sit start with a good hold low and left, and super cool positive three finger hold on the arete, stand up to a sharp half pad side pull above your left hand, follow suit with your right hand, then find a way to the huge ledge slightly below the top. Top out can be sketchy and dirty, but the top corner is good, and theres an exposed root to assist. or you can just jump back down 

  (may be height dependent, I`m 6'1" and probly have another 4-5" before im fully extended on the biggest move.)
content.location: from main entrance over gaurd rail, turn left at the first boulder you pass with obvious chalk on it (anyone know who put up this hard problem??), go to the back of it and in the distance to your left you`ll see a fairly tall boulder with heavy lichen (and a humerous sign telling you to pack out your trash nailed to a tree). this is a popular party/camp spot thats fairly hidden given how close it is to the road.

content.description: short little problem with good holds, and a fun top out. Start in "mouth" towards the far side with the obvious only clean top out spot. make a big move out right and stay close to the arete, grab a sharp small jug then go for the top out.
content.location: Easily found by the obvious graffiti on the face saying "Answer to who?". Enter the main entrance over the guardrail and walk a little ways passed the first boulder on your left, and they look to your left and you should see it. Theres trails that intertwine this whole main area. down climb is...soily, so have a mat to wipe your shoes off or something.

content.description:
short three move problem.start on slanted crimp on arete, and half pad on the roof.bump with your left to a small odd sloper, use a good pocket right above the edge with your right and make strong bump to the top with your left. top out 

  Beware of fairly large wolf spiders here during early summer, accompanied by extreme heat as the sun bakes this rock all day, so its also dry pretty quick. High tide makes this problem inaccesible.
content.location: follow main trail a little ways back, crossing a stream with some waterfalls on your left, you`ll start to drop down towards the river shortly after and you`ll see a fallen tree and a beach, the fallen tree is on top of the boulder, so watch your head toping out. Down climb is obvious, or jump down.

content.description: sit start awkwardly with left hand in decent slot, and a low three finger "pocket". move up with the right to a good lip, and out left to a "seems like its gona be bomb" slot. right hand up to a crappy jug, match and make a big move to the top. downclimb the opposite corner of where you are.
content.protection: Pads, one sketchy big crippler near the start but really shouldnt be falling that direction.
content.location: Enter main entrance over the gaurd rail, first boulder on your left. lots of previously established chalk on this boulder...

content.description:
Public land,hunting permitted during appropriate times of the year. Highly trafficked by the "young and unruly" so beware of broken glass and graffiti. If you can see past all of that,and scrub some moss you`ll find some fairly good sandstone, or some crumbly junk depending where you look. Most good boulders are within the first 100 yards of the entrance, although they don`t stop there. This was apparently once an established area, with a few top rope, or highballs depending who you are. Ive been trying to restablish the area without much luck. People camp there for free all the time, roadside parking is limited and make sure to be completely off the road. Please try to leave the area you`re in cleaner than when you arrived (not a hard task if you pick up atleast one piece of trash). Theres a popular hang out a little ways down the trail that people call the jumping rock where you can swim during the summer (trash gets heavy in this area, be forewarned). All in all potential to be a good little bouldering area right down the road from mcconnells mill, with a little help with clean up, both trails and problems. 

**AS MENTIONED THIS IS A PREVIOUSLY ESTABLISHED AREA, IF ANY OF THE PROBLEMS I POST HAD ALREADY BEEN ESTABLISHED BY YOU OR SOMEONE YOU KNOW, PLEASE LET ME KNOW AND I`LL EDIT THE INFORMATION ACCORDINGLY.***
